meanings.definition: The state of being synchronous or simultaneous.
meanings.sent1: The synchronisms of the dancers' movements impressed the audience.
meanings.sent2: The music and fireworks displayed perfect synchronisms during the celebration.
meanings.sent3: The synchronisms of the traffic lights made the city seem like a well-choreographed dance.
meanings.sent4: The synchronisms of nature's cycles remind us of the harmony in the world.
meanings.sent5: The synchronisms of the clock ticking and the rain falling created a peaceful atmosphere.

meanings.definition: Events or phenomena that occur at the same time or in a coordinated manner.
meanings.sent1: The synchronisms of the planets aligning fascinated the astronomers.
meanings.sent2: The synchronisms of the team members' actions led to a successful project completion.
meanings.sent3: The synchronisms of the birds chirping and the sun rising signaled the start of a new day.
meanings.sent4: The synchronisms of the city waking up at dawn resembled a symphony of life.
meanings.sent5: The synchronisms of the waves crashing and the seagulls flying overhead created a picturesque scene.
